citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee did not submit an itinerary for overnight travel to exhibit at the St. Joseph County Fair.
An itinerary must be submitted to the Animal Welfare Operations office no fewer than two days prior to traveling for
overnight animal exhibition. The itinerary must include the name of the licensed exhibitor, the names, dates and locations
where animals will be housed and exhibited, the animals traveling and on hand that are used for exhibition. An itinerary is
required to allow APHIS officials to inspect licensed facilities when traveling with animals to ensure compliance with the
Animal Welfare Act, and to ensure inspectors do not attempt inspection of the home site if the licensee is in travel status.
All licensee who travel overnight for animal exhibition must submit an itinerary to the Anima Welfare Operations office.
To be corrected from this day forward, October 2, 2023.

The inspector arrived at the site where animals were on exhibit to the public at approximately 11:50 AM. There were no
barriers or attendants present and the public did have contact with the animals. The animals at the site included sheep,
goats, zebu and a dromedary camel. The licensee was called at 11:53 AM and arrived at the site approximately 8-10
minutes later.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals
and the public.
At any time an attendant is not available during public exhibition a sufficient barrier must be present to prevent contact
with the animals.
To be corrected from this day forward, October 2, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
